flashcardContent.english: You are not permitted to park there
flashcardContent.notes: Prohibition using däerfen + net. Important for rules and regulations.

errorDescription: "Ech Du däerfs do net parken Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I you are not permitted to park there to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer:
Du däerfs do net parken, fir Lëtzebuergesch ze léieren.
(You are not allowed to park there to learn Luxembourgish.)

flashcardContent.english: The weather is definitely going to change
flashcardContent.pronunciation: de VEE-der veart sesh be-SHTIMT EN-ne-ren
flashcardContent.notes: Example of wäerten expressing future certainty. Shows reflexive pronoun sech with modal verb.

errorDescription: "Ech D'Wieder wäert sech bestëmmt änneren Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I the weather is definitely going to change to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer:
D'Wieder wäert sech bestëmmt änneren.
The weather is definitely going to change.

flashcardContent.notes: Modal verbs with negation "net". Shows negative ability with kënnen.

errorDescription: "Ech Hatt kann mech net verstoen Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I she can't understand me to learn Luxembourgish.)

flashcardContent.notes: Modal verbs can have implied infinitives when meaning is clear. Here "goen" (to go) is understood.

errorDescription: "Ech Ech muss muer op Bréissel Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I i must [go] to brussels tomorrow to learn Luxembourgish.)

flashcardContent.luxembourgish: Mir hunn den Zuch huele mussen
flashcardContent.english: We had to take the train
flashcardContent.pronunciation: meer hun den tsukh HUE-le MUS-sen
flashcardContent.notes: Example of mussen (must) in perfect tense. Shows past necessity with auxiliary verb hunn.

errorDescription: "Ech Mir hunn den Zuch huele mussen Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I we had to take the train to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer:
Mir hunn den Zuch huele mussen, well den Bus schonn fort war.
(We had to take the train because the bus had already left.)

flashcardContent.luxembourgish: De Film soll ganz gutt sinn
flashcardContent.english: The movie is supposed to be very good
flashcardContent.pronunciation: de film sol gants gut zin
flashcardContent.notes: Example of sollen expressing supposition. Shows how sollen can express what is supposed to be true.

errorDescription: "Ech De Film soll ganz gutt sinn Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I the movie is supposed to be very good to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer:
De Film soll ganz gutt sinn, ech wëll en um Weekend kucken.
(The movie is supposed to be very good—I want to watch it at the weekend.)

flashcardContent.notes: Modal verbs have simplified conjugation: singular pronouns (ech, du, hien/hatt) use singular form, plural pronouns (mir, dir, si) use plural form. du adds -s, dir adds -t.

errorDescription: "Ech Modal verbs: 2 forms only Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I singular and plural forms to learn Luxembourgish.)

flashcardContent.luxembourgish: Mir kënnen e bësse Lëtzebuergesch schwätzen
flashcardContent.english: We can speak a little Luxembourgish
flashcardContent.pronunciation: meer KEN-nen e BES-se LET-ze-buer-gesch SHVET-zen
flashcardContent.notes: Example of kënnen (can) expressing ability. Shows modal verb conjugation with plural subject mir kënnen.

errorDescription: "Ech Mir kënnen e bësse Lëtzebuergesch schwätzen Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I we can speak a little luxembourgish to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer:
Mir kënnen e bësse Lëtzebuergesch schwätzen, mee nach net fléissend.
(We can speak a bit of Luxembourgish, but not fluently yet.)

flashcardContent.notes: ech wëll, du wëlls, hien/hatt wëll, mir wëllen, dir wëllt, si wëllen. Expresses desire and intention. Example: Meng Duechter wëll gär a Frankräich wunne goen. (My daughter wants to go live in France.)

errorDescription: ech wëll, du wëlls, hien/hatt wëll, mir wëllen, dir wëllt, si wëllen. Expresses desire and intention. Example: Meng Duechter wëll gär a Frankräich wunne goen. (My daughter wants to go live in France.)
correctAnswer:
Meng Duechter wëll gär a Frankräich wunnen.
 My daughter wants to live in France.

flashcardContent.luxembourgish: D'Kanner däerfen den Owend méi laang opbleiwen
flashcardContent.english: The children are allowed to stay up longer tonight
flashcardContent.pronunciation: de KAN-ner DEER-fen den O-vent may lahng OP-bly-ven
flashcardContent.notes: Example of däerfen expressing permission. Shows how parents give permission to children.

errorDescription: "Ech D'Kanner däerfen den Owend méi laang opbleiwen Lëtzebuergesch léieren." (I the children are allowed to stay up longer tonight to learn Luxembourgish.)
correctAnswer: D'Kanner däerfen den Owend méi laang opbleiwen
